entry.title: Experiment 4: Playing With randomJumpParameter
entry.content:
Experimental setup:

This experiment has not been performed yet. I am thinking of a few simulations with lower randomJumpParameter untill Analysis #../1 starts to show any signs of learning in the network. If that does not work, maybe trying variable parameters (i.e. stages of exploration-exploitation) will help..

Btw, before running simulations I need to add some more functionality to the main challprop code (or find out where it is hidden…) for accruing the history of weight changes for every link.

‘Sub-experiments’:

randomJumpParameter=25: Experiment 4-1

The next experiment (and all that are comming after it) are based on somewhat corrected codebase (most important are related collection of weight changes history on every link; also some bug fixes on the way….).Experiment 4-2 is just for trying out the new code with 3k agents and randomJumpParameter=99. Nothing resembling self-organization as expected…

Analyses (to do):

same as for Experiment 3:

Analysis #4/1: benefit increase

Analysis #4/2: distribution of challenges

Analysis #4/3: distribution of link weights

Analysis #4/4: degree distribution

Analysis #4/5: random jumps (something to check due to low average degree…)

and some more..:

Analysis #4/..: degree/weight/benefit correlation (comming soon)

Analysis #4/..: dynamics of link weights + clustering (comming later - or maybe for the next experiment)

Analysis #4/..: relaxation dynamics (comming even later…)

anything else ??
